title: Flood Basalts
description:
One of the defining features of the surface of Mars is the stark divide between the heavily cratered highlands on the southern two-thirds of the planet and the flatter, younger lowland plains that make up the northern third. Just north of the divide lies the Central Elysium Planitia—one of two large volcanic regions on Mars and the location of the youngest volcanic rocks (about two million years old) on the planet.

Read more on NASA.
theme:
MARS. The Red Planet, one of the most desirable
destinations for humanity
